title.narrative: KEY INFO ON THE RIGHTS OF CHILDREN

description.narrative: By the end of 2018, increased public & key stakeholder access to information on Namibia's children & Rights of Children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2018, Cross-sectoral support provided for programme effectiveness and efficiency.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2018, increased public & key stakeholder access to information on Namibia's children & Rights of Children.

description.narrative: UNICEF Namibia continued to highlight and raise awareness on children's issues, including during key national and global events such as Global Hand Washing Day and World Children's Day. Social media and IEC materials were produced and disseminated to advocate and inform the public on key children's issues.X | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/12/2018
